ANU.name: Qinghua Qin
interest: Finite element method, boundary element method, Smart materials and structures, Fracture and damage mechanics, Composite materials, Biomechanics, Biomaterials, Solid mechanics, Engineering computation; Nanomechanics; Additive manufacturing; Metamaterial; Artificial Intelligence added Materials Design
ANU.biography: He received his BE degree in mechanical engineering from Xi'an Highway University (currently Chang An University), earning his Master of Science and PhD degrees from Huazhong University of Science and Technology (HUST). Both MS and PhD degrees are in applied mechanics. He joined the Department of Mechanics as an associate lecturer at HUST in 1984, and was promoted to lecturer of mechanics in 1987 during his PhD candidature period. After spending ten years lecturing at HUST, he was awarded a DAAD/K.C. Wong research fellowship in 1994, which enabled him to work at the University of Stuttgart in Germany for nine months. In 1995 he left HUST to take up a postdoctoral research fellowship at Tsinghua University, China, where he worked until 1997. He was awarded a Queen Elizabeth II fellowship in 1997 and a Professorial fellowship in 2002 at University of Sydney and stayed there till December 2003, both by the Australian Research Council, and is currently a Professor in the School of Engineering at the Australian National University, Australia. He has published over 300 journal papers and 8 authored books.
